title: QA/QC in analytical radiochemistry

author: Marko Štrok, Reaktorski center, Institut "Jožef Stefan"

segmentation: Hello, my name is Marco and in this lecture we will explain basics of quality assurance and quality control in analytical Azure chemistry.
This is of crucial importance if we want to ensure early detection of any problems with our instruments or method itself, and that we can take appropriate measures to correct for them.
With that we are able to produce consistent results of required quality to the users of the results.
One way of ensuring this is through accrediting method according to either 17,025 standard it comprises our requirements to ensure this.

Moreover, it does not focus only on the methods and measurement itself, but comprises all provisions to cover a broader aspect of quality system needed for effective management of the quality of work in the laboratory.
In this presentation, we will focus only on quality assurance and control related to the method and instruments itself.
First of all, our method needs to be validated.
This means that we have to check if it produces results with required quality or with other words if it's fit for purpose for what we are using it.

Validation might comprise from analyzing Co reference materials, participating in interlaboratory exercises, determination of linearity of the method, reproducibility, and repeatability determination.
Even if we are using method which has been validated before, we have to check if we can achieve suitable performance.
Also when adopting kit into our laboratory.
After the method is validated, we have to determine crucial parameters which we need to control that the method can still perform results within stated uncertainties and reliability.
These parameters might be room temperature detection, efficiency of instrument, instrument, background, blank cultrate, results of measurements of reference materials or internal standards.
We plot these parameters with time in order that we can easily observe any trends.
This is called control chart.
To establish control chart visual need to have at least 10 inputs.
Better, more or at least one year of measurements that we can account also for seasonal variations.
Once we have that, we can calculate standard deviation of the spread of all results in control chart.
When we calculate standard deviation, we can set up limits for taking actions.
At plus minus two times standard deviation, there is warning, clever and it St standard deviations.
There is action level.
This we can observe on this example.
There is statistical probability that approximately 5% of values will exceed two times standard deviation and 1% will exceed three times standard deviation.
Therefore, we can expect about five values out of 100 to exceed two times standard deviation, and the system is still considered under control.
And reports results if the method is under control, that means that control value is within upper and lower warning limits or control value is between warning connection limit and less.
Two values were within upper and lower warning limits.
The method is under control but not under statistical control.
If seven consecutive control values slowly increases or decreases and are still within upper and lower warning limits.
Or 10 out of 11 lost consecutive control values lie on one side of average value but still within upper and lower limits.
Under such circumstances, we can report results of analysis, but we might expect problems in the future.
Such trends should be discovered as soon as possible that we can prevent problems in the future.

The method is not under control if control value is out of action limits or Contra value is between warning connection limit and at least one out of two less control values is also between warning connection limits.
Under such circumstances we cannot report results of analysis and all samples until the last counter value under control needs to be re analyzed.
Before doing that we need to find the reason why the method is not under control and resolve it.
